define-assembly.name: test-case
define-assembly.description: This is the root element of the FedRAMP Automation Test Suite format for collections of unit tests.

define-field.name: name
define-field.description: The name of the test case collection within a test cases file.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: The description of the test case collection within a test case file.

define-field.name: content
define-field.description: A relative or absolute file path or HTTP URL to the OSCAL document instance for which the test runs.

expect.message: Test content URL does not point to a valid file or HTTP resource. If the path is invalid, tests are not operable. Are you sure it's correct?

remarks.p: In this format, we often use relative paths that are not strictly conformant to the URI datatype in Metaschema.
There, we use the default implied as-type="string" and not as-type="uri".
However, this approach does work and the constraint passes successfully.
At this time, a violation where the test evaluates to `false()` throws a lower-level exception.

define-assembly.name: expectation
define-assembly.description: This assembly defines the relevant constraint ID and the desired result when executing tests over the content. There MAY be one or more expectations.

define-field.name: constraint-id
define-field.description: The @id attribute for a given constraint for which the test serves to match the expectation.

define-field.name: result
define-field.description: The expected result type in SARIF format for the expectation. The expectation only supports specific values, defined in a constraint.

allowed-values.enum: Use when the desired result of test execution without a constraint passing
Use when the desired result of test execution with a constraint violation
